results.q: When did World War II begin?
results.rag: World War II began on 1 September 1939, when Nazi Germany, under Adolf Hitler, invaded Poland, after which the United Kingdom and France declared war on Germany.
results.eng: World War II began on September 1, 1939, when Germany invaded Poland.

results.q: When did World War II end?
results.rag: World War II is generally considered to have ended on 8 May 1945, when Germany surrendered to the Allies.
results.eng: World War II ended on September 2, 1945, with the formal surrender of Japan to the Allied powers.

results.q: When did Germany invade Poland?
results.rag: World War II began with the German invasion of Poland on 1 September 1939 and the United Kingdom and France's declaration of war on Germany two days later.
results.eng: September 1, 1939

results.q: When did Japan attack Pearl Harbor?
results.rag: In December 1941, Japan attacked American and British territories in Asia and the Pacific, including Pearl Harbor in Hawaii, leading the United States to enter the war against the Axis.
results.eng: December 7, 1941

results.q: When was D-Day?
results.rag: D-Day was on 6 June 1944.
results.eng: D-Day was on June 6, 1944.

results.q: When did Germany surrender?
results.rag: Germany surrendered on 8 May 1945.
results.eng: Germany surrendered on May 8, 1945, marking the end of World War II in Europe.

results.q: When did Japan surrender?
results.rag: Japan announced its unconditional surrender on 15 August, and signed a surrender document on 2 September 1945.
results.eng: Japan surrendered on August 15, 1945.

results.q: When did Italy surrender?
results.rag: Italy surrendered in September 1943.
results.eng: Italy surrendered on September 8, 1943.

results.q: When did the Battle of Stalingrad end?
results.rag: The Battle of Stalingrad ended on 2 February 1943.
results.eng: The Battle of Stalingrad ended on February 2, 1943.

results.q: When did the Soviet Union enter the war against Japan?
